subject: RE: [junit] Re: ClassNotFoundException
msgSnippet: We are running 3.5.2... Are you still trying to run with the JUnit jar?  If so, move away from that. Import the source into VAJ in a new project called JUnit,
messageBody:
We are running 3.5.2...

Are you still trying to run with the JUnit jar? If so, move away from that.
Import the source into VAJ in a new project called JUnit, or whatever suits
your fancy. Then try the solution I listed below, it ought to work! If it
doesn't there is still something different about our environment settings.

-Jason

> -----Original Message-----
> From: messy_head_2001@... [mailto:messy_head_2001@...]
> Sent: Thursday, August 23, 2001 1:10 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Re: ClassNotFoundException
>
>
> still the same problem when I try
>
> Class.forName("className");
>
> in my code
>
> !!!!!
>
> are you using VA3.5 or a different version?
> I notice there are a lot of bugs in 3.5....
>
>
>
>
> --- In junit@y..., "Jason Rogers" <jason.rogers@t...> wrote:
> > Well, I tried a test app (following) and it worked for
> me. Without
> the
> > fixClasspath() call though, it didn't. So, perhaps
> including the
> > project_resources subdir does not works as automagically as I
> thought
> > (because I tried to include just its dir and that didn't work).
> >
> > Have you tried the fixClasspath/setClasspath method yet?
> >
> > -Jason
> >
> >
> > ********** TEST * CODE **********
> > //imports
> >
> > public class Tester extends TestRunner {
> > public Tester() {
> > super();
> > }
> > public static void main(String[] args) {
> > String[] newargs = new String[1];
> > try{
> > fixClasspath();
> > newargs[0] = Class.forName("<a class
> name>").toString
> ();
> > TestRunner.main(newargs);
> > } catch (Exception ex){
> > ex.toString();
> > }
> > private static void fixClasspath(){
> > Workspace workspace = ToolEnv.connectToWorkspace();
> > Object[] classpath =
> workspace.getClassPathEntries();
> > Object[] projects = workspace.getProjects();
> > Object[] newClasspath = new
> Object[classpath.length +
> > projects.length];
> >
> > //add the projects to the new classpath
> > System.arraycopy(projects, 0, newClasspath, 0,
> projects.length);
> >
> > //add the original classpath to the new classpath
> > System.arraycopy(classpath, 0, newClasspath,
> projects.length,
> > classpath.length);
> >
> > try {
> > workspace.setClassPath(newClasspath);
> > } catch(IvjException e) {
> > e.printStackTrace();
> > }
> > }
> > }
> > }
